Title: Where Does Weed Grow Naturally? - Tripsitter

Where Does Weed Grow Naturally?

Cannabis, a plant that has coexisted with human civilization for millennia, holds a complex history of domestication and adaptation. Here's where it grows wild today and where researchers think it originated from.

By Phil Dubley

Last Updated: February 02, 2024

Categories

Cannabis

Contents

  • What's the Perfect Climate for Wild Weed?
  • Is Weed an Invasive Species?
  • What's the Difference Between Wild Weed & Cultivated Weed?
  • What's the Difference Between Wild Weed & Ditch Weed?
  • Is Wild Weed Legal?

What's the Perfect Climate for Wild Weed?

As you might've guessed, this wide habitat range means weed can grow just about anywhere. From Amsterdam to Calcutta, cannabis is not a picky plant when it comes to climate. The different subspecies (indica, sativa, and ruderalis) have different preferences, but weed is a hardy plant.

Is Weed an Invasive Species?

Technically, yes, but it's more complicated than that. An invasive species is an organism not native to a particular area and can cause damage to the local environment.

Food for Nature

As with anything in nature, weed is part of the food web. Many critters will flock to wild cannabis plants to devour them. The leaves, seeds, and roots of the plant are all highly nutritious and loved by herbivores around the world.

What's the Difference Between Wild Weed & Cultivated Weed?

Most of the weed we use comes from unfertilized female plants. Growers discard the male plants as soon as possible, as they don't produce flowers, and fertilized females make fewer cannabinoids. Wild weed is not subject to those controls ‚Äî males and females grow freely, and humans do not curate fertilization.

What's the Difference Between Wild Weed & Ditch Weed?

You might have heard people referring to wild strains of weed as 'ditch weed' and assumed it's a synonym for all kinds of wild marijuana. But these terms don't refer to the same thing.

Is Wild Weed Legal?

As most weed lovers already know, marijuana laws are changing ‚Äî and they're changing fast.

Frequently Asked Questions About Cannabis

  • Where does cannabis come from?
  • Can you smoke wild weed?
  • What's the difference between wild weed and regular weed?

References

  • Jehangir, S., Khan, S. M., Ahmad, Z., Ejaz, U., ul Ain, Q., Lho, L. H., ‚Ä¶ & Raposo, A. (2023). The Cannabis sativa L. in the Western Himalayas: a tale of the ecological factors behind its continuous invasiveness. Global Ecology and Conservation, e02779.
  • Canavan, S., Brym, Z. T., Brundu, G., Dehnen-Schmutz, K., Lieurance, D., Petri, T., ‚Ä¶ & Flory, S. L. (2022). Cannabis de-domestication and invasion risk. Biological Conservation, 274, 109709.

Title: Need to Detox from Weed? Here Are 4 Methods to Try - Tripsitter
Content:
{ "title": "Need to Detox from Weed? Here Are 4 Methods to Try", "content": "

Need to Detox from Weed? Here Are 4 Methods to Try

By Phil Dubley

Last Updated: February 02, 2024

Contents

Weed Detox: Fundamentals

THC (tetrahydrocannabinol) ‚Äî the active ingredient in marijuana ‚Äî can saturate fat cells throughout the body, making detoxing quite a bit more challenging than other substances. Don‚Äôt fret; there are ways to clear THC from the system more quickly, but it takes some discipline. Here‚Äôs how it‚Äôs done.

1. Abstain from THC

The most straightforward way to detox from weed is to refrain from using THC products. If you‚Äôre applying for jobs, take time off from weed right away to give your body more time to flush it all out of the system. It will be easier to pass a drug test if you anticipate it.

2. Increase Liver Detoxification With Supplements

The liver processes THC into 11-OH-THC. This metabolite is the compound most urine drug tests look for. By increasing the liver‚Äôs ability to convert THC to 11-OH-THC, you can eliminate it from the body more quickly. Many products are designed to help with this ‚Äî usually in the form of detox drinks, powders, or capsules.

3. Increase Urination

Drinking water frequently while detoxing is important for eliminating THC from the body. Water helps flush the 11-OH-THC from the bloodstream. Diuretics are also helpful. These are substances that increase the frequency of urination, combined with plenty of water, are the best way to clear THC metabolites from the body more quickly.

4. Promote Fat Burning

THC is fat-soluble, which means it will accumulate in stored fat cells. This stored THC can slowly infuse back into the bloodstream and show up on a drug test. An important step during the detox process is to try and flush this stored THC from the fat cells through increased exercise and calorie reduction.

How Long Does Weed Stay In Your System?

The amount of time weed stays in the system largely depends on how often you smoke. Other factors that influence THC detox include genetics, size and weight, age, and illness.

Cannabis Withdrawal Symptoms

The most common symptoms associated with marijuana withdrawal include irritability, anxiety, trouble sleeping, decreased appetite, restlessness, and more. While these can be challenging, they are not considered severe and should improve after a week.

FAQs: Weed Detox

  • Can you speed up weed detox?
  • What happens if you get caught cheating on a drug test?
  • Are detox teas effective?

References

References are provided for further reading on THC detox and marijuana withdrawal symptoms.

" }

Why Does Weed Make You Hungry? The Link Between THC & Appetite

Food and weed go together like peanut butter and jelly ‚Äî everything just tastes better. Ever wonder why?

By Phil Dubley

Last Updated: February 01, 2024

Categories

Cannabis

Contents

Why Does Food Taste Better When You‚Äôre High?

How Long Do the Munchies Last?

Managing the Munchies

Does Weed Cause Weight Gain?

Can You Block Your Cannabinoid Receptors?

FAQs: The Weed Munchies

1. Do edibles give you the munchies?

2. Will CBD make me hungry?

3. Is sativa or indica better for hunger?

Why Does Food Taste Better When You‚Äôre High?

This is another well-known effect of the munchies ‚Äî not only do you feel hungrier and crave specific types of food, but they also taste better.

The answer is, again, cannabinoids. When THC interacts with your brain to increase your appetite, it also affects brain receptors associated with taste. This makes the brain‚Äôs response to sweet food stronger while also making you crave fatty foods.

How Long Do the Munchies Last?

Every person reacts differently to weed, so the answer varies depending on individual reactions and how much marijuana is consumed.

If you smoke weed, the effects take up to 10 minutes to manifest and last for 2 to 3 hours. But if you eat or drink cannabis, the effects won‚Äôt manifest until 2 hours later, with the effects lasting between 6 and 8 hours (if not more).

Managing the Munchies

The best way to reduce or avoid the munchies when smoking weed or eating edibles is to consume low-THC products.

As THC is the primary (but not only) cannabinoid responsible for increasing appetite, taking smaller doses can lessen or completely negate the munchies. Products labeled as ‚ÄúTHC microdoses‚Äù are the least likely to give you the munchies.

Does Weed Cause Weight Gain?

The answer to this question is complicated, and there is conflicting evidence, but so far, most studies show that there is no link between cannabis use and BMI.

Can You Block Your Cannabinoid Receptors?

We know that cannabinoid receptors (specifically CB1) increase appetite when activated by THC, so it makes sense that blocking them would decrease it.

FAQs: The Weed Munchies

Here are the answers to some questions you might be asking.

1. Do edibles give you the munchies?

2. Will CBD make me hungry?

3. Is sativa or indica better for hunger?

References

Koch, M. et. al. (2015) Hypothalamic POMC neurons promote cannabinoid-induced feeding. National Center for Biotechnology Information.

...
